newsitem.title: SWEDEN: AGA slips over 4 pct on 9 months result.
newsitem.headline: AGA slips over 4 pct on 9 months result.

text.p: Shares in Swedish gas company AGA slipped over four percent in early trade on Monday after posting weaker than expected nine month figures.
By 0915 GMT AGA shares were 4.5 crowns lower at 101 crowns.
AGA earlier posted a 14 percent fall in profits after financial items to 1.38 billion crowns for the nine months ending September 30, compared with market consensus forecasts of 1.42 billion.
AGA itself forecast full year 1996 profit would be at least 15 percent less than in 1995.
"(This is) due primarily to a continued weak economic climate in several countries and the stronger Swedish crown," AGA said in its nine month report.
